meanings.sent1: I will repaint the fence to make it look new.
meanings.sent2: She decided to repaint her bedroom in a different color.
meanings.sent3: After the rain, the kids wanted to repaint the sidewalk with colorful chalk.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to repaint the portrait multiple times to get it just right.
meanings.sent5: The old house needed a fresh coat of paint, so they had to repaint it entirely.

meanings.definition: To apply a fresh coat of paint to something.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will repaint the chair to make it look brand new.
meanings.sent2: They plan to repaint the walls of the office over the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The children wanted to repaint their bikes with bright colors for the parade.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was so bad that they had to repaint the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to repaint the canvas to cover up the mistake he made.
